name: Braised Collard Greens
author: THYME4MA
summary: My Grandma Ollie-Belle made the best 'greens.' This recipe is as close to hers as I could come. The 'pot-liquor' is the key to great greens!! Serve with fresh green onions and black-eyed peas with rice.
ingredients: 2 pounds collard greens - rinsed, stemmed and thinly sliced
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place ham hocks, salt pork, onion, bay leaves, red pepper flakes, and sugar in a large pot with the chicken stock
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 30 minutes
Stir   into the pot, and bring to a boil
Reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 30 minutes, or until greens are tender
Season with red wine vinegar and salt and pepper to taste
